hero.title: Design, Simulate, and Visualize Quantum Circuits
hero.subtitle: A powerful visual platform for quantum computing exploration. Build complex quantum circuits, partition them intelligently, and analyze results with professional-grade visualizations.

features.title: Powerful Features
features.subtitle: Everything you need to explore quantum computing, from circuit design to advanced analysis

visualComposer.title: Visual Circuit Composer
visualComposer.description: Build quantum circuits with an intuitive drag-and-drop interface. Support for all standard quantum gates including Hadamard, Pauli, CNOT, Toffoli, and custom gate definitions.

partitioning.title: Advanced Partitioning
partitioning.description: Optimize large circuits with intelligent partitioning algorithms including Kahn topological sort, minimum cut strategies, and depth-balanced decomposition for efficient execution.

simulation.title: Real-Time Simulation
simulation.description: Execute quantum circuits instantly with our high-performance statevector simulator. Support for multiple qubits with real-time measurement and state visualization.

visualizations.title: Professional Visualizations
visualizations.description: Analyze results with interactive 2D and 3D visualizations including Bloch spheres, density matrices, entanglement entropy charts, and measurement histograms.

management.title: Circuit Management
management.description: Organize your work with nested circuit support, QASM import/export, circuit versioning, and seamless state persistence across sessions.

educational.title: Educational Platform
educational.description: Perfect for learning quantum computing fundamentals with visual feedback, step-by-step execution, and comprehensive result analysis for every simulation.

squander.title: Powered by SQUANDER
squander.description: Built on SQUANDER (Sequential Quantum Gate Decomposer), a cutting-edge C++/Python framework developed at Eötvös Loránd University. SQUANDER excels at decomposing n-qubit unitaries into optimized quantum circuits using parallel processing, vectorized AVX kernels, and innovative gradient-free optimization techniques that effectively circumvent barren plateaus.

capabilities.subtitle: Professional tools for quantum circuit development and analysis
